meanings.definition: The amount that a cart can hold.
meanings.sent1: The farmer loaded a cartload of hay to take to the market.
meanings.sent2: She bought a cartload of groceries for the big family gathering.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended their toy cars were carrying a cartload of treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a cartload of joy that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking was a cartload of comfort on a cold day.

meanings.sent1: The factory produced a cartload of toys for the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: He had a cartload of work to finish before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party was a cartload of fun for everyone involved.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a cartload of sunshine on a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The student's enthusiasm was a cartload of motivation for the whole class.
